channel.title: BBC News | Technology | UK Edition
channel.description: Updated every minute of every day - FOR PERSONAL USE ONLY

item.title: Texts aim to fight Aids in Kenya
item.description: An information mobile text service is being launched in Kenya to help tackle the HIV/Aids pandemic.

item.title: China 'blocks Google news site'
item.description: China has been accused of blocking access to Google News by the media watchdog, Reporters Without Borders.

item.title: Music sharing continues to thrive
item.description: A steady growth in legal music downloads continues while illegal file sharing networks also flourish, analysts say.

item.title: Half-Life 2 maker wins legal case
item.description: Half-Life 2 maker Valve has won a legal battle over who controls access to its games in cyber cafes.

item.title: Broadband boost for rural areas
item.description: A 40km stretch of road is being dug up over four months to bring high-speed internet access to Cumbria.

item.title: Pupils to get anti-piracy lessons
item.description: Songwriter Guy Chambers helps schools introduce lessons on music piracy and copyright.

item.title: 'Super-rocket' aims for January
item.description: Europe's heavy-weight Ariane 5-ECA rocket, which exploded in 2002, will return to flight early next year.

item.title: Studios snub Sony DVD format
item.description: Three Hollywood studios are to use next-generation DVD technology backed by Toshiba.

item.title: Abbey cards in net security scare
item.description: Abbey bank cancels about 1,000 credit and debit cards after receiving a security warning over an online merchant.

item.title: TV in Hindi via the red button
item.description: A BBC One documentary will be broadcast in both English and Hindi for the first time.

item.title: MMO2 signs Japanese net deal
item.description: MMO2 gears up to launch i-mode internet services in the UK, Germany and Ireland.

item.title: Call for action on internet scam
item.description: Phone companies are not doing enough to warn about net rogue-dialling scams, says the UK telecoms watchdog.

item.title: Screensaver tackles spam sites
item.description: A screensaver targeting spam-related websites could help drive spammers out of business.

item.title: Cingular to launch US 3G network
item.description: Cingular, the largest US mobile phone operator, is to launch a high-speed third generation (3G) network.

item.title: Kazaa launches file-swap defence
item.description: Lawyers for file-swapping software firm Kazaa launch their defence in a landmark Australian internet music piracy case.

item.title: First look at PlayStation 3 chip
item.description: The chip that will power the PlayStation 3 is said to be up to 10 times faster than current processors.

item.title: Australian labels sue Kazaa owner
item.description: Australian record companies, including the world's four major labels, are suing the firm behind the Kazaa file-sharing software.

item.title: Need for Speed 2 sees off rivals
item.description: Catch up with the latest news from the world of video gaming.

item.title: No half measures with Half-Life 2
item.description: Installation bugs barely dent the greatness of Half-Life 2, says reviewer James Bregman.

item.title: Nintendo DS aims to touch gamers
item.description: Nintendo launches its new handheld console, the DS, which aims to change the way people play games.
